Creator: IBM
Original operating system: AIXefn |name=note11 |IBM introduced JFS with the initial release of AIX Version 31 in 1990 This file system now called JFS1 The new JFS  on which the Linux port was based  was first shipped in OS/2 Warp Server for eBusiness in 1999 The same sourcebase was also used for release JFS2 on AIX 5L

Creator: Microsoft
Original operating system: Microsoft Windows  Linux  "classic" Mac OS  and FreeBSD

Creator: Microsoft
Original operating system: MSDOS 710 / Windows 95 OSR2efn |name=note10 |Microsoft first introduced FAT32 in MSDOS 71 / Windows 95 OSR2 (OEM Service Release 2) and then later in Windows 98 NTbased Windows did not have any support for FAT32 up to Windows NT4; Windows 2000 was the first NTbased Windows OS that received the ability to work with it
